hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Contraction Breakout (VCB) in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of low volatility (Bollinger Band Width 20-day < 0.05) during a NEUTRAL regime, a daily close above the upper Bollinger Band (20,2) on above-average volume signals the start of a new directional trend. A long position entered on the next open will yield positive returns over the next 5-10 days more consistently than breakouts occurring in high-volatility or STRESS regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression (low BB Width) represents a coiling of energy and indecision. A breakout from this compression in a NEUTRAL regime, confirmed by volume, often marks the resolution of indecision and the beginning of a new, sustained directional move. The NEUTRAL regime filter is key, as breakouts in BULL may be late-cycle and in BEAR/STRESS may be false.
entry_conditions: Bollinger Band Width (20-day) < 0.05 for 5 consecutive days

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the lower Bollinger Band (20,2)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The win rate for this setup is below 55%, or the average profit factor (Avg Win / Avg Loss) is below 1.5 when tested across multiple historical NEUTRAL regime periods.
